wikipedia_page.main: Sir Charles Reed Peers  (22 September 1868 – 16 November 1952) was an English architect, archaeologist and preservationist.  After a 10-year gap following the death of Lieutenant-General Augustus Pitt Rivers in 1900, Peers became England's second Inspector of Ancient Monuments from 1910 and was then the first Chief Inspector of Ancient Monuments from 1913 to 1933.
